title: How Seyond Built LiDAR for Every Range: The Tech Behind Physical AI
partialText: Seyond offers a complete LiDAR portfolio covering ultra-short to ultra-long ranges, giving robots and autonomous vehicles high-fidelity 3D perception. Their Falcon and Robin sensors, paired with OmniVidi software, allow real-world semantic understanding, supporting navigation, collision avoidance, and industrial automation. Manufacturing in the US and global deployment positions Seyond as a key player in Physical AI.

title: Inside Will Jiangâ€™s Ethical Growth Hacking Strategy for Social Media
partialText: Will Jiangâ€™s career spans Instagram and Rednote, where he has built scalable growth systems rooted in usability rather than manipulation. From redesigning Instagramâ€™s multi-account experience to modernizing Rednoteâ€™s internationalization infrastructure and launching LLM-powered translations, Jiang demonstrates that sustainable user growth comes from reducing friction, respecting users, and building intuitive products that earn trust at scale.

title: Building ML-Ready Data Platforms on Cloud: Turning Experiments into Systems
partialText: Machine learning models rarely fail in production because of flawed algorithms. They fail because the underlying data platform lacks enforceable guarantees around ingestion, historical correctness, transformation logic, and observability. As ML systems mature, reliability depends on reproducibility, bounded freshness, and cross-team alignment. Organizations that treat data platforms as production infrastructureâ€”not analytics toolingâ€”reduce operational risk and build AI systems that scale sustainably.

title: Rust Rewrite, Postgres Exit: Blitz Revamps Its â€œLeague of Legendsâ€ Backend
partialText: Blitz rebuilt its League of Legends backend to handle massive write-heavy workloads and real-time game overlays. The team migrated from Postgres and Elixir to Rust and ScyllaDB Cloud, eliminated Riak and most Redis usage, and replaced 100+ cores of microservices with just four Google Cloud nodes. The result: lower latency, 5K ops/sec at under 20% load, simpler ops, and reduced infrastructure costs.

title: A 1975 Algorithm Still Beats Brute Force in Modern Keyword Search
partialText: When brute-force keyword matching becomes computationally impossible at scale, Aho-Corasick offers a linear-time solution by building a trie with failure linksâ€”enabling real-time, multi-pattern search across millions of inputs without brute-force overhead.

title: Grok 4.2 vs. Sonnet 4.6: Early Impressions From Hands-On Testing
partialText: Grok 4.2 attempts a multi-agent orchestrator, and it's... interesting, but not yet effective. And what does Sonnet 4.6 mean for most of us?

title: Substackâ€™s Architecture Is Quietly Dismantling the Guru Economy
partialText: This article argues that Substack is structurally designed to prevent guru-style power concentration. By aligning incentives around paid subscriptions instead of advertising, enabling peer-driven discovery, prioritizing ownership and exit rights, and building around long-form, trust-based relationships, Substack creates a distributed â€œgardenâ€ ecosystem. In an era where AI can mass-produce authoritative content, platforms that reward originality, depth, and earned trust may become increasingly valuable.

title: The Day I Watched 300 Students Stop Pretending and Start Building
partialText: AI FEST 2026 was held at Chandigarh University in India. The event was designed to help students build their own start-ups. It was the first of its kind in India, and was backed by Venture Catalysts.

title: Indifference Strategies and Viscosity Solutions in Worst-Case Portfolio Optimization
partialText: Explore the connection between indifference BSDEs and PDEs in financial modeling. Learn how viscosity solutions and stochastic volatility models like Heston and Bates define worst-case optimal trading strategies.

title: BSDE Characterization of Indifference Strategies for Worst-Case Portfolios

title: Optimizing Pre-Crash Portfolios: Indifference Strategies and Stochastic Market Coefficients
partialText: Discover the solution to the pre-crash portfolio problem using logarithmic utility and stochastic market coefficients. Learn how super- and subindifference strategies define the optimal worst-case investment frontier.

partialText: In self-evolving AI ecosystems, safety is no longer just about individual models. It is about interactions. No single agent intends instability, yet collective dynamics generate it. Local intelligence does not guarantee global stability.

title: ArtemisFlow: A Local-First Job Tracker I Built
partialText: ArtemisFlow is a local-first job tracker designed specifically for tech candidates. There is no login, no external database, and no onboarding process. You open the app, add an opportunity, and it becomes part of your pipeline.
